title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Tuesday 27 February - BBC News
summary: search of leicester explosion site continues .
two teens injured in suspected stabbing .
girl in induced coma after attack .

documents.title: latest school closures for derbyshire
text: several more schools in derbyshire have decided to close due to the wintry conditions .
these have just been added to the county council 's list :
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: nottinghamshire school closures
text: two more nottinghamshire schools have shut due to the cold weather :
author: James Lynn
BBC News, Nottingham

documents.title: cold snap closes oakham school
text: it 's a snow day for more pupils in rutland .
unfortunately are having to close the school today .
we apologise for the inconvenience but have to put the safety of staff and children first .
stay safe everyone xx
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: more derbyshire schools stay shut
text: a number of primary schools in derbyshire have also closed due to the snow and ice - clowne junior school , town end junior school in alfreton , and tibshelf infant and nursery school .
darley churchtown ce primary school will be open from 10:00 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: freezing weather closes secondary schools
text: the cold weather has led to a few secondary schools in derbyshire opting to close today - lady manners in bakewell , tibshelf community school and highfields school in matlock .
the county council has the latest list here .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: snow forces closures of a537 and a53 in peak district
text: the continuing wintry weather 's forced the closure this morning of the a537 cat and fiddle , from macclesfield to buxton , and the a53 leek road , from leek to buxton .
derbyshire county council says conditions in places are treacherous and temperatures have plummeted .
this is a623 at tideswell a few minutes ago .
pretty clear of snow , but possibility of ice due to plummeting temperatures .
take care if travelling .
roads closed : a57 snake pass , a53 leek road , a537 cat & fiddle , a6024 holme moss , monk road - chunal to charlesworth .
just to say thanks to the highways teams working unbelievably hard to keep the roads open & the updates on social media .
well done !
thanks steve , we are all doing our best , will pass on your comments to our gritting crews .
winnats pass open ?
good morning .
yes , open - but like all routes in area , strong possibility of ice due to exceptionally low temperatures .
please take extra care if travelling .
thank you all is good with winter tyres
author: Lee Thomas
Newsreader, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: 'bad weather ' closes rutland school
text: no school for pupils at casterton college in rutland today .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: wintry weather closes schools
text: the cold weather has led to a trio of schools in nottinghamshire deciding to stay closed today .
bulwell st mary 's c of e primary school , newark orchard school and the brunts academy in mansfield will all be staying shut .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: stranded cars on rutland route
text: there are also problems near rutland - this road has been closed for several hours .
# a1 remains closed in both directions between the # a1m j17 and the # a6121 # tinwell due to stranded vehicles following severe weather throughout the night .
@ twitterid are on scene with multiple gritters and snow ploughs working to clear the road , pls plan ahead .
is it closed or moving slowly ?
mixed reports online .
appreciate it 's a tough time but just trying to plan journeys .
hi gareth , the road is now open but there is still very slow traffic in the area .
we will update this feed as best we can with all the info we receive , obviously advice is to allow extra travel time .
when will be open again ?
hi john , the road is now open but there is still very slow traffic in the area .
we will update this feed as best we can with all the info we receive , obviously advice is to allow extra travel time .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: cold weather closes routes in derbyshire
text: freezing conditions overnight have led to a number of routes in the high peak area being closed .
these include the a57 snake pass , a6024 holme moss , a53 leek road and a537 cat & fiddle .
derbyshire county council said temperatures had plummeted to -9c overnight , meaning grit fails to stop working fully to melt snow and ice .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC News

documents.title: snow causes 'extreme delays ' on a1
text: police are warning motorists to avoid the a1 north of peterborough this morning .
beds , cambs and herts roads policing unit tweeted to say it is closed northbound and southbound with `` extreme delays '' .
one person replied saying : `` i found this out the hard way '' .
this google traffic flow map gives an impression of the problems that the snow is causing in the area .
# a1 is closed both ways btwn the # a1m j17 + # a6121 at # tinwell due to severe weather conditions .
all strategic traffic is advised to use the m1 if within the closure , we are working to get you moving .
nbound traffic now being turned by police .
gritters and snow plough at scene
thanks to this tweet i have been able to go back to bed and not try to get to essex from derbyshire
please do not use a1 north of peterborough .
it 's currently closed north and south with extreme delays .
@ twitterid
just north of where i 'm going , ho hum
phone in
called my boss snow day for me
i found this out the hard way
is it still closed ?
thanks
thank you for the update .

documents.title: m1 fatal crash driver 'on autopilot '
text: m1 fatal crash driver 'on autopilot '

text: mother and two sons 'among blast dead '

documents.title: neighbour jailed for murdering friend
text: neighbour jailed for murdering friend

documents.title: evans resigns as mansfield manager
text: evans resigns as mansfield manager

documents.title: our live coverage has ended
text: dedicated live coverage has ended for today but some breaking news , sport and travel will continue to appear through the night .
we will be back again tomorrow at 08:00 .

documents.title: watch : on the road with the gritters
text: the beast from the east is here - councils are out furiously gritting roads so we can all get home tonight .
but how does it work ?
watch this handy explainer , filmed before the snow arrived , to find out .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: 'safeguarding concern ' at repton school
text: police have been called in and an investigation is underway involving a staff member at the prestigious repton school in derbyshire .
police confirmed that officers are dealing with safeguarding concerns at the school .
repton said it is `` working with and dealing in full with the relevant external agencies '' .
it added that it has `` robust safeguarding procedures in place to protect '' its pupils .
fees at repton can cost upwards of £ 34,000 a year .
author: East Midlands Today

documents.title: have you seen david storer ?
text: officers are concerned for the safety of a 72-year-old man who has gone missing from swadlincote .
derbyshire police said david storer was with his family at the railway inn on monday but did not return home .
mr storer , who is from linton , is described as 5ft 9ins tall and stocky with short , fair hair .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: road cleared after tram crash
text: this was the car that crashed into a tram earlier this afternoon near nottingham 's victoria embankment .
nottinghamshire police said nobody was injured and the road has now been cleared .
the tram service is now running as normal .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: strictly winner attends charity gala in memory of newark teenager
text: pop singer and winner of strictly come dancing jay mcguiness was among the guests at a charity ball in his hometown newark .
more than £ 16,000 was raised at the fifth sam white legacy ball , which raises funds for the queen 's medical centre .
the money also pays for respite breaks for families with children who have cancer .
the annual ball is held in memory of sam white ( who died from an infection in 2013 aged 16 , after battling with a brain tumour for more than three years .
since his death , parents pam and mike , from newark , have raised thousands of pounds to help other children with similar conditions .
more than 30 local sporting heroes attended the gala at the newark showground on saturday which also saw live music , games , a disco and an auction .
pam said : sam would be so proud to see how many people support his hopes for the future to help young people with a brain tumour . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: neighbour jailed for murdering friend
text: a 46-year-old man from long eaton who stabbed and killed his neighbour has been jailed for life with a minimum of 15 years .
nigel mcgurk , 63 , was found with fatal stab wounds and died at the scene at west park court , on broad street , last august .
jeffery beers , who lives in the same building block , was convicted of murder at nottingham crown court yesterday .
det insp steve shaw , of derbyshire police , said the men were friends , but people described their relationship as `` futile '' .
he said : `` this was a sad and tragic end to a life . ''
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News

documents.title: woman , 93 , attends trial run of 'own funeral '
text: meet ethel .
she 's marvellous .
author: Dave Wade
BBC News

documents.title: driver 'hit woman in anti-muslim attack '
text: driver 'hit woman in anti-muslim attack '

documents.title: snow covers cricket ground
text: wow , that is a lot of snow !
this was the scene at nottingham 's trent bridge earlier today - thankfully there is n't a match for a few more weeks .
trent bridge # snow update
hi there - would it be ok for @ twitterid to use this footage in our coverage with a credit to the club please ?
thanks
hi stephen , yes that would be fine , if you could credit and @ twitterid on twitter that would be great .
great , thanks
might take spin put em in to bat
no cricket today then
not keen are they ?
still looks more chance of some play there today than the odi in september , eh @ twitterid
you 'd get 12 overs in in that no bother .
would n't suit a white ball game much !
give it half an hour bring back swanny at the ratcliffe road end and see if it does a bit !
red ball would be fine .
if we have a team .
12 months ago to the day in antigua for the o.d.i .
's oh to be there now
would be great to play snow cricket here hahaha
melted in 5 minutes though ! !
white ball will be a bit hard to up
snow use worrying about it
no cricket today then chaps ?
umpires out in the middle deciding on what time play should start .
batsmen padded up ready to go .
dig in
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: vehicle overturns in snowy conditions
text: motorists in derbyshire are being warned to take care after this car overturned in ambergate .
the force said the driver escaped without injury following the crash on the a610 in ambergate .
one lane remains shut while the vehicle is recovered .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: former circus ringmaster against government 's animal ban
text: a former circus ringmaster has hit out at government plans to ban travelling circuses from using animals .
currently , 19 animals including zebra , a macaw , camels , a fox , raccoons , and reindeer are currently being used by circuses on the road .
kevin baines , from derbyshire , said that it `` will be a shame '' to see them banned completely .

he continued : `` the animals were treated better than we were , ate before us , they were looked after and bedded down for the night before we were are they going to ban zoo 's because they have animals too ? ''
the pledge to ban wild animals has been welcomed by animal defenders international .

president jan creamer said : circuses can not meet the needs of animals in small , mobile accommodation and we 've repeatedly documented suffering and abuse we congratulate the uk government on consigning this outdated act to the past where it belongs . ''
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: breast cancer deaths 'most likely in newark and sherwood '
text: women under the age of 75 in newark and sherwood are most likely to die from breast cancer in england , according to a new report .
the report released by an all-party parliamentary group showed rushcliffe had the highest number of early detections in the country , with 88 % of breast cancers found at stage one or stage two .
it also found the east midlands had some worrying gaps '' in its breast screening workforce and some of the longest waits to see a specialist compared to other regions .
mps are now calling on the government to address the matter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: tram delays because of accident
text: worth noting if you are going to catch the tram this afternoon
due to a road traffic accident we currently have no service between queens walk and wilford village .
nct navy line buses are accepting our tickets and passes .
thought you had to call it an rtc these days
any idea/updates when this will clear ?
navy line busses do n't go near the park and ride at wilford village
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: appeal to trace owner of missing camera
text: derbyshire police are asking for help to identify the people in some christening photos on a camera that was found in a derby street .
the camera was handed in last week after being discovered on howe street on monday 19 february .
police have released some photos that were on the camera in an effort to track down the owners .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: council preparing for more snow
text: it looks like the gritting team at nottinghamshire county council is prepared for more snow
freddie salted jr got caught in the snow flurry !
the gritting team are going to be very busy battling the # beastfromtheeast this week we have 10,000 tonnes of salt stocked and ready for use .
that 's enough for 50 back to back gritting runs !
# winter # snow # grittertwitter
he is so brave .
freddie salted jr is n't afraid of the # beastfromtheeast .
take that !
made me laugh - thanks for helping to keep the roads clear .
might as well sell it to the east coast they need it more !
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: nottingham 'worst place ' outside london for illegal gas work
text: illegal gas works taking place in nottingham are putting people at risk , according to research by the uk 's official gas registration body .
gas safe register has rated nottingham as the worst city in the country outside of london with 72 % of illegal gas work found to be unsafe .
the risks posed to people in the event of an unqualified engineer tampering with gas include carbon monoxide poisoning , gas leaks , fires and explosions .
the organisation is urging people to check their engineer is on the gas safe register , to ensure they are legally qualified to work in your home .
author: Hayley Compton
Reporter, BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: 'round-the-clock ' gritting in derbyshire
text: there should be plenty of salt on the road this evening
our round-the-clock gritting continues we 're out treating all primary and secondary routes this afternoon and evening .
we plan to be out on the primary network again from 4am tomorrow .
there 's plenty of grit on the roads , but please drive with extra care .
stay warm and safe .
thank you !
have been very impressed given all the crazy snow
thanks angela , we do our best .
thank you to your hard-working team of gritters .
secondary routes never seen a gram of grit around somercotes area .
thanks to all of you working so hard to keep us safe
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: radio station fined for ofcom breach
text: a nottingham radio station has been fined £ 2,000 after playing music which `` glorified historic battlefield victories '' against non-muslims , ofcom said .
radio dawn , a muslim community station , broadcast a nasheed , a devotional music piece , on 26 december 2016 .
the watchdog said the track broke the rules as it suggested that `` similar acts committed now would bring honour to islam '' .
owners karimia limited said they were `` extremely embarrassed by what happened '' and `` did not agree with the content '' as it `` went against their aims to build trust among communities '' .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: latest from explosion site
text: new show the extent of the damage to the area where an explosion happened at a shop on hinckley road .
rescue workers are expected to remain at the site for several days to identify the cause of the blast on sunday night .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: selby 'not worried by form '
text: mark selby says he is n't worried by his form with the world championship just two months away .
despite making the semi-finals of the world grand prix last week the world number one was critical of his `` poor '' performances .
selby is through to the second round at the welsh open after a 4-2 win over christopher keogan .
if my form was like this a week before the worlds then i 'd be a bit worried but hopefully in the next few tournaments i can play myself into form . ''
author: Mike McCarthy
BBC Radio Leicester Sport

documents.title: farmer ploughs on with marathon tractor effort
text: for most people , running a marathon is a daunting challenge but a lincolnshire farmer has decided to go a step further .
craig williamson , who farms near gainsborough , decided to make a three-quarter scale costume version of his own tractor to run the london marathon in .
he says he wanted his costume `` to be a bit shocking '' to raise as much awareness of his chosen charity , the lincolnshire and nottinghamshire air ambulance .
last time he ran the marathon - without a costume - he raised £ 5,074.89 for the helicopter , he 's hoping to beat that target this year .
good luck craig , you should be quite easy to spot on the tv , so i 'm sure there will be lots of people watching out for you and your tractor ! ''

documents.title: living out loud
text: a new support group for transgender adults launches tomorrow at leicester 's lgbt centre .
the living out loud project has been developed to support adults who identify as transgender or who are questioning their gender identity .
it will also give families and relatives information , guidance and help .
the group meets tomorrow at 18:00 .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: 'distinctive jewellery ' stolen in burglary
text: a collection of `` distinctive jewellery '' has been stolen from a home in darley abbey .
officers say the offender forced their way through the front door and took a gold cross necklace with coloured diamonds , a white gold curb-chain necklace , a bracelet and a gold emerald ring .
derbyshire police said cash was also stolen .
it happened between 18:00 on 17 february and 09:00 on 19 february in belper road .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC News

documents.title: m1 crash deaths : driver in fatal crash on hands-free call
text: the trial of a driver who crashed into a minibus killing eight people continues today .
yesterday , reading crown court heard david wagstaff , 54 , had been on an hour-long hands-free call when the crash on the m1 near milton keynes happened in august .
the jury was told that when mr wagstaff hit the minibus , which was taking passengers from nottingham to london , he forced the vehicle into and under a lorry being driven by ryszard masierak .
minibus driver cyriac joseph - who was killed in the crash - was waiting with his hazard lights on for the chance to pass mr masierak who had allegedly stopped on the m1 near newport pagnell .
both mr masierak , of stoke-on-trent , and mr masierak , of evesham , deny causing death by dangerous driving , and four counts each of causing serious injury by dangerous driving .
mr masierak faces a further eight charges of causing death by careless driving , while over the prescribed alcohol limit .
author: BBC News

documents.title: 'no survivors ' left in wreckage
text: rescue teams at the site of sunday night 's explosion on hinckley road in leicester do n't expect to find anymore survivors in the wreckage .
five people remain in hospital , one is in a critical condition .
the cause of the explosion is still unknown .
tragically , all we are now looking for is any further human remains .
this is vital work that is being done , on behalf of the victims and their families , and it will take some time to complete . ''
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: nottingham fatal crash murder suspect dies in prison
text: if you missed this yesterday , a man who was charged with the murder of a pedestrian has died in prison , it has been confirmed .
simon mellors , 56 , of berkeley court , nottingham , had been charged over the death of janet scott who was hit by a car on 29 january in nottingham .
mr mellors had also been accused of the attempted murder of another man in the same crash .
a prison service spokesman said he died in hmp manchester on sunday and an investigation had been launched .
author: Greig Watson
Reporter, BBC News Online

documents.title: rescue dog 'transforms life ' of man with asperger 's
text: a man with asperger 's syndrome says his rescue dog has transformed his life .
robin jones from mansfield said he could n't even get up in the morning due to crippling anxiety and found it difficult to speak with strangers .
now his six-year-old collie labrador cross charlie has been trained to pull the covers off robin 's bed and force him to get up .
here is charlie in action

robin said : `` with charlie being able to get the blankets off and giving kisses , i am no longer getting up because mum is dragging me out of bed charlie needs me to get up because charlie needs his breakfast . ''
robin says charlie has helped him to improve his social skills .
author: Hugh Casswell
Reporter BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: major revamp of derby market hall will start this spring
text: millions of pounds are to be spent by the city council on a major revamp of derby market hall .
the authority has awarded a £ 5m contract to wates construction for the first phase of a three-year project .
the city council says the money is from its coffers for one-off projects , so the project does not mean money has been taken away from the day-to-day running of the city .
author: Derby Telegraph

documents.title: your snow
text: the white stuff has arrived across much of the east midlands this morning .
this was the scene at the victoria embankment in nottingham .
there was a dash of spring with some snow flurries in sneinton , nottingham .
this was market warsop
and here was nottingham city centre
and this was near melton mowbray
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: blue plaque for radio derby presenter andy potter
text: radio derby presenter andy potter was remembered with a special blue plaque yesterday celebrating his contribution to the arts in derbyshire , exactly one year after his death .
andy died from cancer on 26 february last year , just weeks after announcing his illness live on the station 's breakfast show .
at a ceremony outside the radio station yesterday , family , friends and work colleagues spoke about their memories of him and how fitting it is to call him a `` champion of the arts '' .
wife anne said : `` he would have been really happy with this tribute , we 'd have never heard the end of it . ''
he presented the afternoon show at the time of his death and had a following of regular listeners who were thanked by andy 's son simon .
`` people like you make me realise what an impact he had on your lives to the family , he meant so many different things we just remember him and smile . ''
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: nottinghamshire announce profit in 2017
text: nottinghamshire announce profit in 2017

documents.title: victims of leicester explosion named
text: shane , sean and their mother mary ragoobar are believed to be among the five people who died in the blast at the flat above the shop on the hinckley road in leicester .
five people remain in hospital , one is in a critical condition .
the cause of sunday night 's explosion is still unknown .
author: BBC Radio Leicester

documents.title: mansfield trio sign new deals with club
text: mansfield trio sign new deals with club

documents.title: paralympic champion to try new distance at 2020 games
text: nottinghamshire paralympian richard whitehead says he is looking at trying a new distance at the 2020 paralym in tokyo .
the 200 metre gold medalist will be 43 in two years time but says running 400 metres will continue to motivate him .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: purse and cash stolen from 94-year-old woman
text: a cctv image has been released showing two people police would like to speak to in connection with the theft of a purse from a 94-year-old lady .
the incident took place at marks and spencer in matlock between 15:00 and 17:00 on saturday , 17 february .
the woman believes the purse was taken from her trolley as she was walking around the shop , as well as cash and bank cards .
the purse contained a silver horseshoe pendant which is of sentimental value .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: private ambulance service 'waste of nhs money '
text: a man from nottinghamshire who relies on a private ambulance to get him to and from his hospital appointments says the arriva transport service is a waste of nhs money and `` unreliable '' .
andrew turner from annesley requires the vehicle because of his need for a special wheelchair and stretcher .
he said he 's previously waited three days to be taken home after surgery and been several hours late for an appointment because of the ambulance .

a statement from mark feather , national head of operations at arriva said : `` we have contacted mr turner to apologise for the service he has received and also talked to him about his individual mobility needs . ''

the statement continued : `` we are also working with hospital colleagues to ensure transport for patients with more complex requirements are booked in advance we are fully committed to providing high-quality transport for all patients in nottinghamshire . ''
author: BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: police hope to trace taxi driver after assault
text: derbyshire police are looking for a taxi driver who may have information about an assault that took place in long eaton .
a woman has told police she was pushed to the ground earlier this month by a man who later walked towards ruskin avenue .
the 19-year-old had just got out of a taxi from nottingham when she was pushed from behind by a slim man in dark clothing .
police are hoping the taxi driver , an asian man , who originally her up from upper parliament street on 13 february , may have witnessed what happened and are trying to track him down .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: mansfield trio sign new one-year deals
text: mansfield trio sign new one-year deals

documents.title: titanic officer medals up for auction
text: medals once owned by a sailor some think could have stopped the titanic from sinking are to be sold .
retired headteacher murray shaw , from derby , is auctioning off the collection which once belonged to second officer david blair .
mr blair was replaced when the ship docked in southampton but accidentally kept the key to the locker containing telescopes for the lookouts .
it 's thought they would have allowed lookouts to spot the icebergs before it was too late for the titanic .
the liner sank on her maiden voyage from southampton to new york on 15 april 1912 with the loss of 1,522 lives .

mr shaw said : `` if mr blair was on the ship , i do n't believe it would have sunk at an inquiry afterwards it was said , if the telescopes had been available , the accident could have been avoided the key was taken totally by accident . ''
the medals are up for auction next month at hansons auctioneers in etwall .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: a52 reopens after lorry crash
text: derbyshire police have re-opened the a52 following the incident earlier this morning
# a52 between osmaston & shirley now open after recovery work was completed .
if you were delayed our thanks for your patience .
driver escaped with minor injuries .
# highways # travel # derbyshire
i think you may have forgotten to remove the road closed sign at markeaton island related to this accident .
tonka toy doing a good job
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: teen in induced coma after victoria centre attack
text: a teenager has been left in an induced coma after being assaulted by a group of women in nottingham city centre .
the attack on the 18-year-old woman happened outside the victoria centre at about 20:00 last tuesday .
she was punched several times before she was followed onto the number 27 bus where the verbal abuse continued .
the woman was taken to the queen 's medical centre where she remains in an induced coma .
nottinghamshire police is now appealing for witnesses to the attack .
author: Gillian Brown
BBC Radio Nottingham

documents.title: dozens attend leicester explosion meeting
text: a public meeting has taken place on hinckley road , following sunday night 's explosion and fire in leicester .
five people died in the incident , with five others being treated in hospital , one of whom remains in a critical condition .
the investigation into the cause of the explosion is set to continue in the area for a number of days .
about 80 people attended last night 's meeting - including leicester west mp liz kendall - organised by the emergency services and the city council at dovelands school .
author: Namrata Varia
BBC Radio Leicester producer

documents.title: cold weather expected to fill derby 's homeless shelters
text: homeless charities say they 're preparing to give extra support this week as the cold snap hits derbyshire .
more snow is forecast today with a yellow warning issued by the met office and temperatures are struggling to get above freezing .
managers at derby city mission night shelters are predicting they 'll be at full capacity during this period .
sean is homeless and told bbc radio derby that he 's concerned about the incoming weather .
he said : `` i do n't know how i 'm going to cope to be honest , i will have to get some extra blankets and stuff to keep warm . ''
author: Wesley Mallin
Reporter, BBC Radio Derby

documents.title: two teens injured in suspected stabbing
text: a 15-year old boy has been arrested after two teenagers suffered suspected stab wounds in attenborough .
a 14-year-old girl and a 16-year-old boy were taken to hospital yesterday afternoon after the incident in long lane .
nottinghamshire police said the extent of their injuries are not yet known .

documents.title: crash closes a52 near ashbourne
text: the a52 is closed in both directions near ashbourne this morning following this crash involving a lorry .
derbyshire police said the vehicle jack-knifed on a bend , causing the car and two lorries it was carrying to fall off .
the driver was reported for summons for insufficient tethering and securing of load .
recovery is currently taking place and it 's expected that the road will be closed for some time .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News

documents.title: join us for our live coverage
text: hello and good morning .
maryam qaiser and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
we will of course be keeping you informed of the latest developments from the hinckley road explosion in leicester too .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Chris Fawcett
BBC News
